data.title: Musicians born on May 3
data.meta_description: List of musicians who were born on May 3
data.text:
Born on May 3

Michael Kiwanuka is born in the Muswell Hill area of North London, where he's raised by his Ugandan parents. After touring as Adele's opening act, he wins the BBC Sound Of 2012 poll (over Frank Ocean and Azealia Banks) and releases his debut album, Home Again. In 2016 he goes to #1 in the UK with his second album, Love & Hate.

Josh Tillman is born in Rockville, Maryland. He is the drummer for Fleet Foxes before going solo as Father John Misty.

Country singer Eric Church is born in Granite Falls, North Carolina.

Sterling Campbell is born in New York City. An accomplished drummer, he has stints in several bands including Duran Duran, Soul Asylum and The B-52s.

Electronic musician David Ball (of Soft Cell) is born in Blackpool, England.

Bruce Hall (bassist for REO Speedwagon) is born in Champaign, Illinois.

'70s soft rocker Christopher Cross is born Christopher Charles Geppert in San Antonio, Texas.

Mary Hopkin is born in Pontardawe, Wales. She signs with The Beatles' Apple Records in 1968 after a winning performance on the UK TV competition show Opportunity Knocks, and releases her first single, "Those Were The Days," later that year.

John Richardson (drummer for the Rubettes) is born in South Ockendon, Essex, England.

Pete Staples (bass guitarist for The Troggs) is born in Andover, Hampshire, England.

'60s pop singer Frankie Valli (of The Four Seasons) is born Francesco Stephen Castelluccio in Newark, New Jersey.

James Brown is born in Barnwell, South Carolina, but will be raised in Augusta, Georgia.

Country singer Dave Dudley is born David Darwin Pedruska in Spencer, Wisconsin.

Jazz trombonist Jimmy Cleveland, who would accompany Lionel Hampton, Miles Davis, and James Brown, is born in Wartrace, Tennessee.

Traditional pop vocalist Joe Ames (of The Ames Brothers) is born in Malden, Massachusetts.

Pete Seeger is born in Manhattan. Throughout his career, Seeger champions folk music and uses the form to push for civil rights and environmental issues.

Betty Comden is born Basya Cohen in Brooklyn. Along with her partner Adolph Green, she writes the screenplay for Singin' In The Rain along with many other musicals.

Bing Crosby is born Harry Lillis Crosby Jr. in Tacoma, Washington.
